meanings.definition: Shock or excite (someone) into taking action.
meanings.sent1: The inspiring speech galvanizes the crowd to stand up for what they believe in.
meanings.sent2: The urgent call to action galvanizes people to make a difference.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the movie galvanizes the audience, leaving them on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The sudden thunderstorm galvanizes the sleepy town into a frenzy of activity.
meanings.sent5: The passionate performance galvanizes the audience, stirring their emotions and driving them to action.

meanings.definition: Coat (iron or steel) with a protective layer of zinc.
meanings.sent1: The factory galvanizes the metal beams to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers galvanize the steel structure for durability.
meanings.sent3: The clever inventor decides to galvanize the metal parts with a shiny zinc layer.
meanings.sent4: The old bridge was galvanized to extend its lifespan and protect it from corrosion.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith carefully galvanizes each piece of armor to ensure its longevity on the battlefield.

meanings.definition: To stimulate or arouse to activity.
meanings.sent1: The energetic music galvanizes the dancers to move with passion and joy.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speaker galvanizes the audience to pursue their dreams with determination.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies galvanizes the sleepy children, making them rush to the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The exciting news galvanizes the community, sparking a wave of positive change.
meanings.sent5: The colorful artwork galvanizes the viewers, inspiring them to unleash their creativity.
